lamblin.tweetstats

Class MessageWorkerPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • lamblin.tweetstats.MessageWorkerPool

  • public class MessageWorkerPool
extends java.lang.Object
    Each message added to this worker pool is run by a Executors.newWorkStealingPool(). The parent thread accumulates counts as totals of each word from messages added with addMessage(String). It also retains a sorted set of words for outputting words in order. Then the worker passes each message's count of unique words, via a ConcurrentLinkedQueue to the runnable worker RunningMedianTask, which is started by startUniqueWordsRunningMedian(RunningMedian, PrintStream).

    • Method Detail

      • addMessage

        public void addMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Adds messages with words to be counted. You cannot add messages after calling either getCounts() or getSortedWords().
        Parameters:
        message - the message for which to increment its words' counts

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        The total number of unique words added.
        Returns:
        the total number of unique words

      • getCount

        public int getCount(java.lang.String word)
        How many of a given word were counted.
        Parameters:
        word - being counted
        Returns:
        The number of times the word being counted was seen in all messages

      • getCounts

        public java.util.Set<com.google.common.collect.Multiset.Entry<java.lang.String>> getCounts()
        The unordered entry set of words and their counts. Getting this will terminate the accumulator's thread pool and disable the addMessage(String) method.
        Returns:
        a set of words and their counts

      • getSortedWords

        public java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String> getSortedWords()
        The ordered set of words counted. It does not include their counts. Getting this will terminate the accumulator's thread pool and disable the addMessage(String) method.
        Returns:
        a set of the words in natural order

      • startUniqueWordsRunningMedian

        public void startUniqueWordsRunningMedian(RunningMedian<java.lang.Integer> runningMedian,
                                          java.io.PrintStream medianUniqueWordsOutput)
        Sets one long-running Runnable to gather and resequence the counts of unique words out of the queue and output the current running median of these counts to a stream with receipt of each.
        Parameters:
        runningMedian - the running median implementation to use to update the median
        medianUniqueWordsOutput - the PrintStream to output the running median to
